function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Unsupervised machine learning used to segment data into infectious and noninfectious periods, leading to potential misclassification of COVID-19 infection periods.","Impact":"Misclassification of infectious periods could result in failure to detect and isolate COVID-19 cases, leading to increased transmission.","Mitigation":"Implement supervised machine learning with labeled infectious and healthy periods to ensure accurate classification of COVID-19 infection periods.","Technologies":"Supervised machine learning algorithms, labeled datasets, validation standards for COVID-19 detection.","People":"Researchers, developers, and data scientists working on wearable technology for COVID-19 detection.","Owner":"Research institutions, healthcare organizations, regulatory bodies."},{"Description":"Lack of validation standards for wearable technology used in early detection of COVID-19, leading to inconsistent accuracy results and unreliable performance.","Impact":"Inaccurate detection of COVID-19 infections and misleading results from wearable technology devices.","Mitigation":"Establish validation standards specific to COVID-19 detection for wearable technology, and ensure consistency in reference tests and accuracy measures.","Technologies":"Validation protocols, standardized reference tests, regulatory clearances specific to COVID-19 detection.","People":"Research community, regulatory bodies, healthcare professionals.","Owner":"Health authorities, regulatory bodies, standardization organizations."},{"Description":"Inconsistent accuracy results and heterogenous specificity and sensitivity values in wearable technology for COVID-19 detection, leading to uncertainty in the performance of the technology.","Impact":"Uncertainty and lack of confidence in the accuracy of wearable technology to detect COVID-19 infections, potentially leading to false reassurance or unnecessary interventions.","Mitigation":"Standardize accuracy measures, establish clear criteria for sensitivity and specificity values, and ensure transparency in reporting accuracy results.","Technologies":"Standardized accuracy metrics, clear criteria for performance evaluation, transparent reporting guidelines.","People":"Healthcare professionals, researchers, public health officials.","Owner":"Health authorities, regulatory bodies, research institutions."}]}
